name: Assembly of Scientists and Experts of Afghanistan
goal:
The Assembly of Scientists and Experts of Afghanistan (ASEA) will operate as an international Think Tank organization, both in and outside of Europe, with the following goals:
• To support need for freedom, Restoring Peace and Strengthening of democracy, welfare, equality, social justice, human rights and cultural richness,
• To review, analyses, collaborate, cooperate and provide scientific and technical advice to all institutions, from all over the world, especially to the government and people of Afghanistan to consolidate a national government responsible for effective governance, transparency and professionalism,
• To try and find practical ways to eliminate poverty and create a prosperous society with peace and serenity for good integration with economic development, and provide sustainable livelihoods in urban and rural areas,
• To provide technical guidance for the sustainable management of the natural wealth, human resources, employment eligibility with equal opportunity citizens,
• Academic and professional consultation in all sectors, for example reconstruction of infrastructures and moral support for the society,
• To create and coordinate voluntary jobs in all sectors of the economy in order to reduce unemployment in the society,
• To cooperate in the development and strengthening of friendly relations with other social organisation and institutions to ensure a peaceful society,
• To encourage people and the society maintain the environment and the vegetation
and try to provide advice for implementation of renewable energy.
• The promotion of the cultural and noble beliefs and values of the people, firmly opposing any type of religious, racial, ethnic, linguistic or regional radicalism.
• Freedom of thought and expression is one of the fundamental principles of the Assembly based on the principle of collective management and individual responsibility.
• The development of the high ideals of freedom (national and civil), democracy, welfare, equality, social justice, cultural diversity and human rights.
• The study, analysis, scientific and technical cooperation and offer the necessary advice to Afghans to establish a national government and responsible for the administration, efficient, transparent and professional.
• Find practical ways to eliminate poverty, create a confluent community with peace, security and stability, which promotes economic development and provides sustainable livelihoods for balanced growth in rural and urban areas.
• To establish specific guidelines for the proper use of natural and human resources, job creation and the work of all citizens of Afghanistan.
• Scientific advice for the reconstruction in various areas of the material and spiritual life of the Afghan people.
• Communication and coordination with national and international administrations, academic institutions and independent personalities, in relation to all aspects, economic, cultural and social.
• The research in order to achieve the most effective methods of peaceful coexistence and mutual respect with the regional countries and the whole world.
As the clarity is vital, Assembly of Scientists and Experts of Afghanistan intent to do these goals by:
• Organise and attend national and international scientific conferences and research programs to find the best ways, methods and solutions,
• Try to have constructive dialogues with the political parties, independent personalities, civil society and human rights to provide for cooperation, for example, in Afghanistan,
• Plan and forecasts of various economic projects to meet the urgent needs of the people such as water supply,
• Provide a transparent forum for political and economic cooperation between the government of Afghanistan and international institutions with the consideration of mutual respect,
• Sharing the research accomplished by the Assembly of Scientists and Experts of Afghanistan with the media.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Communication, Consumers, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, External Relations, Food Safety, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Research and innovation, Sport, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
